definition: hard to say/can't guarantee/difficult to protect/difficult to preserve
Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)
like a clay Bodhisattva fording a river, can't guarantee his own safety/unable to save oneself, let alone others
pinyin: ni2 pu2 sa4 guo4 jiang1 , zi4 shen1 nan2 bao3

sentences.english: then shall ye make me endanger my head to the king.
sentences.chinese: 这样，你们就使我的头在王那里难保。

sentences.english: Alexander II is very clear, if not abandoned the small profits, then the Italian there is no guarantee.
sentences.chinese: 亚历山大二世很清楚，若不弃小利，则大利难保。

sentences.english: He is now like a clay Buddha fording the river, hardly able to save himself.
sentences.chinese: 他现在也是泥菩萨过河自身难保了。

sentences.english: So that was the end of the shrine.
sentences.chinese: 这就是那座神龛的结局，他自身都难保，如何守护人？

sentences.english: That remark might arouse snickers from people around the league.
sentences.chinese: 这番话难保不会招致联盟其他成员的窃笑。

sentences.english: He could not keep himself safe like mud bodhisattva pass river.
sentences.chinese: 他本人是泥菩萨过河，自身难保。

sentences.english: Okay, so I'm endangering myself so that this evil principle can die?
sentences.chinese: 我自身难保了，这条烂规定可以废止吗？

sentences.english: whereas governments would let some banks fail.
Other works of art that have been revered for generations have eventually gone out of fashion.
sentences.chinese: 有些曾被崇拜了几代的艺术品却最终难保风光依旧。

sentences.english: America's richer trading partners are struggling too.
sentences.chinese: 美国富有的贸易伙伴此刻也是自身难保。

sentences.english: Fir executed longtzer, without authorization in violation of the discipline, even god valley, but also her life.
sentences.chinese: 杉木擅自处死龙泽，违反军纪，连神谷也难保她性命。

sentences.english: The governor, meanwhile, was all but trapped.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，这位省长自身难保。

definition: more likely than not/quite possible/on the cards
more likely than not/quite possible/on the cards
cannot maintain (sth)/unable to keep/more likely than not/may well
to leave the matter at that/to be prepared to let go/to be willing to take things lying down
to expect/to presume/to think (sth is likely)
most likely/mostly (in 8 or 9 cases out of 10)/vast majority
